mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Informs Short of the controversy in the Senate surrounding the approval of the nominated ambassadors: Thomas Pinckney's appointment to England was vetoed, Gouverneur Morris' nomination narrowly passed, and Short's bid for the post at the Hague was approved; Jefferson warns Short against accepting the position, though, because the funding for it is unlikely to be approved; instead Jefferson recommends Short accept a special diplomatic mission to Spain that the President is prepared to offer him.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Morris, Gouverneur, 1752-1816
Pinckney, Thomas, 1750-1828
Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1792 January 28, Philadelphia [Pennsylvania] to [William] Short, n.p.
